Meets expectations... I wanted to tan my legs from sandal area up to my upper thighs. Decided to follow the suggestions, so showered and shaved my legs before using it. After drying off, I applied a moderate amount and applied it with both hands making sure there weren't any areas that had it thicker than others. It worked fine. On one later application, I was rushed so left off shaving until a couple hours after applying this, on the basis that it would be dried off enough. That was a mistake, because along with the little whiskers came a lot of the lotion that had been turned to a gunky consistency. Also, because of the rush I didn't have time to make sure it was applied totally evenly, and ended up with a couple streaks which were embarrassing. As long as you apply this after you have shaved any areas as normal, and then take the time to apply it evenly - even to the point that you gently stroke the area again a few minutes after finishing the application to make sure there are no thick spots left - it works. Take care to not put much at all (if any) on areas of dry or hard skin, such as areas of feet and knees, elbows, etc, because they will end up darker than the rest. This works fine. I think I was right to pick this before a darker tan, and apply a couple times, because it looked much better, much more like a real tan and less like something out of a bottle or tube. The lotion itself made my skin noticeably softer for a few days afterwards, so that was a lovely bonus. I could do without the fragrance, but it's not totally unpleasant.

I'm truly loving this! First let me start by saying that I'm pretty picky when it comes to moisturizers. Love That Added Sunscreen! I just started using L'Oreal Paris RevitaLift Triple Power Deep-Acting Facial Moisturizer last week. I am 36, and I am just starting to see some fine lines around my eyes. I can't speak to whether it improves fine lines or wrinkles yet, because I have only been using it for about a week now. But I'll tell you about what I've noticed about the product so far. Pros: -It goes on light and absorbs well into my skin. I hate heavy, greasy products. This is not greasy or thick. -It has added SPF 30 sunscreen. This is SO important in a daily moisturizer, and definitely will help prevent wrinkles. -I had some acne spots on my face when I started using this product. I did not have any additional breakouts as a result of using this product. -Although the 1.7 oz bottle seems small, you only need a very small amount to cover your whole face. I think this one bottle would last me a couple months. -The packaging is very cute! I love the deep red and purple colors. Cons: -The L'Oreal Paris RevitaLift Triple Power system involves using at least three different products. It can be expensive to buy all three products, and it's a bit of a hassle to use all three over the course of a day. If you like using multiple products, it's not a big deal, but for me, I think I'd prefer a more simple routine. -It is a scented product, which may not be appropriate for sensitive skin. The scent is nice, though--a light, clean scent, and it is less overpowering than some other products I have tried. Overall: I liked this product a lot. I think it worked well for my skin, and I would recommend it to others. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Excellent Moisturizer As in my other reviews, I should start off by telling you my skin type, I think that is very important in understanding if my review will be helpful to you. I have fair skin but tan very easily, more oily than dry and have occasional breakouts and am in my mid-30's. Using a heavy moisturizer has always been a terrible adjustment for my skin because of the oily sensitive nature of it. But I wanted to give this moisturizer a fair chance. It was very thick compared to what I normally use and comes in a jar (which is convenient for getting every last drop of the product). I was amazed for how thick this was (it is definitely more a cream than a lotion), that it blended in quickly to my skin and the only thing that was left was soft skin. There is no oily residue or even any trace that I put it on (except for the softness of course). The scent is the same as the other produces in the Triple Power line, pleasant and not overpowering. I use this in the pm and the first few mornings I woke up with more than normal oily skin. That was expected because my body needs a chance to get used to the chance and to figure out it's oil balance...the more moisture your skin gets the less oil it needs to produce so when you start using a cream or lotion your body will learn to produce less overtime. Now I have no problem and my skin is very soft and visually looking better. And no breakouts! Yay! Its been several weeks since I've started using this and 2 other L'Oreal products in the RevitalLift Triple Power line (Concentrated Facial Serum and the Day lotion moisturizer SPF 20 which I have also reviewed) and absolutely love all three. I would definitely recommend this and the other products in this line! This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Love L'oreal Paris Revitalift Triple Power Deep-acting Facial Moisturizer! L'Oreal Paris RevitaLift Triple Power Deep-Acting Facial Moisturizer is a god-send! I LOVE this moisturizer! I have used it for the past 3 weeks every night as my last facial product. I am a 3xs a week Retin-A user (for anti-aging) and my skin really needs a lot of moisture to balance out the drying effects of Retin-A. I like to use products that are a little heavier at night because my skin soaks them up throughout the night pretty well. Sometimes I feel like I need to use a moisturizer first thing in the morning as well because my skin usually feels pretty dry. I used L'Oreal Paris RevitaLift Triple Power Deep-Acting Facial Moisturizer on my face, neck and decollete. Sometimes I would treat my hands too. When using L'Oreal Paris RevitaLift Triple Power Deep-Acting Facial Moisturizer at night, my skin was surprisigly still pretty fabulously moisturized in the morning (versus other products I have tried). It is easily absorbed by my face without leaving any greasy traces. I love the light, fresh, floral scent too. The added bonus is the anti-aging ingredients that are added to this moisturizer: Pro-Xylane and Hyaluronic Acid. Together, these ingredients help my skin to be more radiant in the morning and nice and soft- a big win win in my book, especially since I am combatting dry Retin-A skin all the time! I felt like my skin looked more rested and therefore, more youthful. I did not use this moisturizer in my morning routine, but after these great nighttime results, I am going to try it out. The only thing I would change would be the packaging. The jar is beautiful, however, I would really like it to come with a pump so the active ingredients are not exposed to the air and the amount used could be more controlled. Lastly, I would definitely recommend L'Oreal Paris RevitaLift Triple Power Deep-Acting Facial Moisturizer to a friend and will most definitely be using it on myself in the future! As long as you follow a few tips this it works great. I mostly use it on my face, When I use it on my face but i use a qtip to wipe excess around just the outside of my nostrils, on my eyebrows and along my hairline. When i use it on my body i apply it where you would normally get sun (ex the top of your arm) and blend it with plain lotion around dry areas of skin, especially the hands, feet and elbows. If you're applying to your arms and hands wash just your palms and inside of your fingers after applying with soap and lightly dry the tops of your hands and knuckles with a towel then use plain lotion on your palms and underside of wrist and blend for best effect.

I Love L'oreal's Revitalift Product Line! Nothing I had tried really worked, yes other products added a little moisture to my face, but you could still see the dryness through my makeup! I tried all 3 of these L'Oreal products together. Good base product, hold factor is almost neglible, dry to light wet finish One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you Yes No Baxter's Cream Pomade claims to be a light hold/soft finish product. It really doesn't feel like a pomade at all. To me, it's just a thick cream that probably could have been put in a squeeze tube.For me, I find the best way to use hair products is to layer them. So I would 1) work in this soft creme, or a comparable workable pomade 2) add a thickening agent like a hard creme and 3) finish with something that gives a firm hold.Also, not a huge believer in the less is more rule when it comes to hair products. I prefer a good finger full evenly worked throughout. Same for this product. I mean I don't goop it on, but using a dime-size isn't enough.Since all hair is different and the styles desired by people too, hair products can be very subjective in how they are rated. That caveat aside, if your hair is short and you do use product, then I'd bet this soft cream could find a home in your hair product selection. It will put your hair into a workable, flexible mode that is ready for shaping in any way you want. I wouldn't use it on it's own because the hold factor isn't there for the style I wear. It just makes the hair maneuverable enough to style the way I want, and then I use something else to lock that style in place. If you were going for a natural comb to one side look, this might be all you need thought. As a closing note, the glass jar this stuff comes in is really cool. Price is a bit high, but it is good stuff.I would use the product again.

Not The Same Product As Previous Reviews I was hoping they would improve upon the previous formula which I loved but was a little thick. It was made with Shea Butter. Any review prior to mine pertain to the old formula and should be disregarded.

Very Effective, But Not Big Enough I was lucky enough to receive a free sample of this product in order to review it in return. I am a person with very fair and dry skin so I am constantly trying to find a product that will provide continually long lasting moisture to my skin. PROS: When it says intensive moisturizing cream it is not lying! After just three days of applying the lotion to my feet, cracks and roughness were almost completely eliminated. I also found it was great for applying to my legs right after I shaved as it left them feeling soft and smooth for hours at a time. CONS: The main issue I have with the lotion is the size. While it would be a good travel size, I want one that can also be kept at home for everyday use. Unfortunately there does not seem to be a larger size offered for the intensive moisturizing line, which I found to be very disappointing. PRICE: I found the price to be a little more then I would want to pay for only a 3oz bottle of lotion. Especially because it is a product that I would like to use on a daily basis, which would mean I would need to purchase a new one almost once a week. However, considering it's effectiveness, and the prices of similar products it is not too unreasonable. Overall I really enjoyed using the product but would be much more willingly to recommend it to others if it were either offered in larger quantities, or offered at a slightly lowered price
love the feel and smell I use this product all season long. Keeps my skin moistured This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Moisturizes skin helps it rebuild itself. I have bad eczema on my knuckles, wrists, and the backs of my hands. My dermatologist gave me a strong topical steroid for it. The steroid tends to reduce the inflammation, but leaves my skin fragile and brittle so it gets broken and damaged again extremely easily, which tends to bring on another eczema outbreak. I can't use a lot of creams, even the ones that say they're for eczema because even they irritated my skin, especially any broken places. I started using this cream in addition to the steroid, and my skin started healing better and feels thicker, stronger, and more elastic, the way normal skin should. I like the combination of the heavier moisurizers, like glycerin and petrolatum, along with the lighter meadowfoam oil. It gives the cream a nice consistency, not too heavy and not too light. The moisture barrier lasts a long time, but it doesn't feel heavy or greasy. I will keep buying this for sure.

I like it! Updated review. Initially I was very, very disappointed that this was not last years version with shea butter that I loved. However, once I tried the new version with Meadowfoam oil cream I loved it even more than the shea butter version. I use it as a hand and body moisturizer (after shower) in the winter months. I felt the consistency was better and easily absorbed into the skin. It did not leave a greasy residue. I love it! Give it a try. I am sure you will Love it too. It is perfect for dry and Sensitive skin.
Love this product!! A friend recommended Austrailian Gold to me 4 years ago because my other lotion was causing rashes. No rashes with AG, and I will never use another tan lotion product.
Excellent! LOVE this product. SO glad Cetaphil is producing lotions now without parabens and an overall higher quality, much more natural product that match EU standards. I will keep buying!!!

Best ever hand cream! I have a serious problem with cracked hands and cuticles that intensifies in winter. I have to wash my hands 10+ times daily. I am also allergic to many fragrances. This cream is the best thing I've ever found to help. It's not greasy, so I can go on with work immediately after applying. THANKS

Great Product! I received this product as a free sample. I have very dry skin and have had poor luck with other creams. I recently gave birth and a side effect was even more dry skin on my hands. Within three application of this cream I noticed a difference and have continued to use it. It works wonderfully. Not greasy at all but you can feel it on your skin. I highly recommend this product. I will be getting one for the diaper bag and my purse!

Fantastic Moisturizing Cream I received a free sample of Cetaphil Intensive Moisturizing Cream to review. Having used other Cetaphil products in the past, I was happy to give this cream a shot. I am happy with the results of using it. My hands are extremely dry - they crack and bleed at times. I have tried many other creams/lotions and could not seem to find one that worked well. This one does! I keep it by my bathroom sink and try to put it on several times throughout the day. I have noticed my dry hands have improved. I will continue to use this product even after this sample one is empty.

New Favorite Moisturizing Cream This product is my new holy grail moisturizer! It feels so nice on the skin and leaves my skin feeling moisturized throughout the day. It also has a pleasant scent that is good for both men and woman. My boyfriend is also a huge fan of this lotion because his hands always get really tough and dry and this works perfectly!

Moisturizing Cream I received a free sample of this moisturizing cream and I LOVE it! It works really well on dry skin. I wear sandals daily and my feet are really dry, so I used this product on my feet every night before bed and I can say that my feet are so much softer now. This cream doesn't leave you feeling oily. The scent of the cream is very very mild, which I really like. I also liked that the lotion was in a tube form. I plan on purchasing another tube to keep it in my purse/diaper bag. I absolutely love cetaphil products because they are made for sensitive skin. I have recently begun using this product on my hands every morning and my hands are very soft! This was a great product and I would recommend you to purchase it!

Great Moisturizing Cream, Especially For Extremely Dry Skin This cream is fantastic! I have very dry skin, and I have two children with eczema. So finding a good quality moisturizer is very important here! I am very impressed at how well it moisturizes my skin and my girls'. It keeps our skin feeling hydrated for a long time, too. I was unsure about the size of the tube since we go through so much lotion here, but since it is an intense cream a little does go a long way. I would buy a bigger size, if it was available. With our extrememly dry skin, on top of other sensitive skin issues, we have been recommended Cetaphil brand products by my dermatologist and our pediatrician. So I trust the brand. I did recieve this product as a sample to try in exchange for a review, however I can say with all honesty that I am very impressed and will be purchansing this regularly in the future.

Great Cream Without The Greasy Residue! I received a free sample of the Cetaphil Intensive Moisturizing Cream to review. I have a toddler, am a bit of a germophobe, and wash my hands on a consistent basis, so my hands can get very dry (especially in the winter). The cream is scent free and has a nice consistency - not too thick, so it can be used on elbows, knees, feet, etc. The cream contains shea butter which is super moisturizing, but doesnt leave a greasy residue. Love that Cetaphil has made a lotion with shea butter!

Very heavily fragranced I bought this last week to use on my infant son and have to return it due to the very heavy fragrance - a major irritant for sensitive skin/eczema. I am disappointed as the other ingredients sounded promising, but nothing that is marketed for use for babies or eczema should be so scented. I cannot comment on the quality or effectiveness as we will not be using it.
Love it!!! I have been using this lotion for several years. So glad I can buy it online as it is not in stores.

Made it worse I'm 22 years old with eczema so I thought for sure a butter made for babies should be good for me. My first impression was that it was the perfect texture with a pleasant scent. But after multiple uses I'm sure this product is making my skin worse. Currently writing this review at 3 in the morning because I'm up itching after using this butter. Please don't use if you/your child has extremely sensitive skin. I know in theory Chamomile should help soothe the skin but I must be allergic to something in this product. Keep in mind I've used plain raw Shea butter before and didn't have this problem.

A little disappointed I love Sheamoisture products, but this new formula is something I'm very disappointed with! The color is different, the smells off and I wondering if it still has the same healing properties! Every time I fall in love with a product, you all up n change something about it.

product is not uniformly mixed I think it is inherently a great product with quality ingredients, but the container arrived to me in a state ... hmm .... kinda like previously melted chocolate ... you know, how it it gets that white stuff that separates out and makes it seem not as good as it might've been before it got over-heated? Like it.. Have been using and tried every type of eczema product for my DS and not as effective as i would like.. but this product loved it.. him being a boy he doesnt often let me moisturize his skin daily.. this helped.. started about everyday.. then every other and now twice a week.. no more rough patches.. itchiness and he loves putting it on himself.. fragrance a bit strong..

Good for eczema It's doesn't cure eczema (because there is no cure) but it's one of the few things that doesn't sting my daughter's moderate eczema. We go through about one container a week as we use it twice daily all over. She actually loves the grainy texture because it 'scratches' her itchy skin as I'm applying it.

Love it! This, in combination with the Eczema Therapy soap bar, has improved my psoriasis and keratosis pillaris. It smells delightful! However, it is rather greasy in texture. This doesn't bother me, as I put it on before bed, and it moisturizes my sensitive skin very well!

Only thing that's has worked! After going to at least 5 dermatologists, trying every cream/lotion recommended (usually petroleum based) and submitting my 3 yr old to several different strengths of topical steroids for over a year I've finally found something that works! It hasn't cured him but has improved his condition drastically. We apply it in the morning before dressing, in the evening before bed and under those heavy footed pjs (really keeps the moisture in). I always keep his nails trimmed to prevent the scratching. For his condition its key to keep him moisturizer at all times so we sometimes spot treat thoughout the day if I catch him itching, and as a last resort I use Benedryl topical to control the itching. No more steroid creams for us! One day of slacking on this regimen and we have issues! Good luck, I know it's frustrating!

I'm hooked I have definitely taken this company for granted, I wasn't so sure it would work but I did more research and found that this is a phenomenal company and their products are amazing! My 2 month old son developed baby eczema and I was prescribed by his doctor hydrocortisone which smelled weird and also left my baby's skin looking patchy so I stopped using that and was just using greasy Aquaphor, I then discovered this product and just after one use my sons neck (where most of the patchiness was) was cleared up over night! The smell is amazing! It smells to me like lemon cake I love that the products are 100 natural, non gmo, and organic! A little trick for the customers upset about the quality of the product just pop it in the microwave for 20 seconds stir until grittiness is gone then place it in the fridge until it hard again and boom just like new. Remember it's a natural product so there will be some separation but it's an easy fix.

Totally cleared in 1 week! I never write reviews but it was because of the reviews that I tried this product for my daughter...so I felt an obligation to give back! My daughter has ....or had I should say eczema behind her knees and she could not wear shorts all summer!! Until we started using this 'liquid gold'! I will never be without this cream, customer for life!!!

Love this!!! My baby had very dry spots on his body (mainly his buttocks) and the Johnsons lotion and petroleum jelly wasn't working at all, it was actually making it worse. So I visited my local CVS and saw this and decided I'd try it out bexcuse the dry places couldn't possibly get any worse as it was scaly. When I opened it, I was very pleased with the smell it's not too loud and it smells alot like Burts bees lip balm. So the next day after I put it on his skin, I immediately noticed a big change. His skin was very soft, not completely resolved but very close. The next day, it was almost completely gone and now it is the third day and the dryness is very faint, I believe it will be back to noemail tomorrow. I saw some reviews that complained about heating it up, but I just rub it between my fingers before applying and it does fine. I have nothing was positive things to say about this product and I will be looking into other Shea moisture products!! When my husband and brought little man home, we began to search for baby eczema products, not realizing we were already supporting a company that supported the very product we were seeking, LOL!!! It took about 4 weeks of research (we were using Burt's Bees Baby Wash Baby Lotion during that time-it wasn't working) and we finally discovered Raw Shea Butter Chamomile Argan Oil Baby Eczema Therapy by Shea Moisture. Our handsome son has never had an eczema outbreak since we began using this product and we don't plan on buying anything else. We bathe him with Shea Moistures Raw Shea Chamomile Argan Oil Baby Wash. All the other body washes we have tried by SM (trying to explore different fragrances) actually DID irritate his sensitive skin, so we immediately threw those out and went back to the Raw Shea... Argan.

Each September, as soon as temps drop from 80's/90's to 70's, my skin seems to sense the oncoming winter, instantly/overnight goes into 9 solid months of winter shock- Eczema flares on 1 elbow, hands immediately become bone-dry, chap, crack, have sharp edges of dried, peeling skin, bleed, become beet-red/raw, appear OLD. I've tried everything, from pure Vaseline (petroleum), to cortisone creams. This Baby Eczema Cream is a miracle! My hands are young again after just a few days of using this cream. (It protects my skin to allow healing, while preventing further damage, keeping skin soft, supple, young.) It's so rich! After 1/2 hour or so, it absorbs into skin- but keeps my skin moisturized protected all day- without that artificial, greasy feel of aquaphor (Vaseline). I once shook my Dr's hand upon greeting, after I'd applied aquaphor 5 hours earlier... I was so embarrassed that my hand felt greasy gross (to him). This miracle cream sinks in moisturizes much better, without that greasy/grimy/gross skin feel. I apply every am, re-apply after soap-washing my hands, again before bed. I smooth this cream onto my forearms lower legs, too. The fragrance is delicate- but unisex- the oils in this cream hold onto my perfume all day, too. DIG IT !!!

I hope they haven't discontinued this - contains an amazing array of butters! For those who have "sandy" or grainy butters; microwave the open jar for a few seconds at a time until the butter melts. Great cleanser! Great cleanser for a drug store brand! Cleans very well but does not over-dry, even when I use this to clean before my retin a gel. The only thing is, it foams a lot (too much when I use my clarisonic with it) but it still works so well and I love the scent and cooling sensation. The cooling is nice-noticeable but not too strong. My skin seems clearer and balanced when I use this. It has 2 sal acid. I'm almost 40 and still get blemishes. My skin has become drier with age (and my skincare regimen) but this reminds me of those anti acne anti aging cleansers at a fraction of the price. They are meant to clean, exfoliate, treat blemishes while not over-drying. This is one worth trying! I think it would be good for body acne too.

excellent product I've been using this cleanser for 5+ years. I have moderate acne and this makes a huge difference as far as blackheads/whiteheads are concerned. The bottle lasts a long time, foams very nicely. It is fairly concentrated, so you don't need a lot. My face is oily and it keeps the oil down. Be careful when using it in combination with other acne products like benzoyl peroxide, it may be too drying and irritate your skin. However, I combine mine with a 10 sulfur mask I use daily, and it works great.
Great product Finally a product that clears my complexion

Great for sensitive skin I have sensitive skin, but not necessarily in the traditional definition of sensitive. As long as I have a routine and don't alter it, my skin is fine. The moment I introduce a new product that doesn't agree with my skin, that's when the sensitivity becomes an issue and I either experience a breakout, a patch of eczema, or both. This cleanser is gentle enough to not dry out my skin, but it also is effective enough to fight acne breakouts. I am 27 and I have PCOS, so I do suffer from occasional acne despite my age. This is less powerful than something designed for teenagers with a lot of acne, but not so gentle that it leaves oil on my face after use. Just right! I tried a few different products during a brief time when I could not find this product in stores, and nothing compared to it. I also enjoy the tingling feeling it leaves on my face. Don't stop making my face wash, Biore! My skin thanks you!

My all time FAVORITE lip balm! II'm IN LOVE WITH THIS LIP BALM! I noticed my old lip balm wasn't doing much for my lips. I decided to try this out because of the scent. It's not too strong so it will work for people who are sensitive to strong scents. It also works VERY QUICKLY to sooth and moisturize chapped lips. It's pretty rich but it has a very lightweight formula. This is the PERFECT lip balm for me. I'll never use anything else. My lips have never been smoother. This also works great for a lip primer! Just make sure to rub it into your lips first.

It's a dry heat (inside) part II I bought two Nivea lip products. The coral lip care/balm/tint and Kiss of Milk and Honey. This is a wonderful product--the description is accurate. All the above and more. It isn't fragrant unless I'm missing something I don't mind--it's gentle and soft. Luscious and more then a soda pop flavored lip balm. A real soother for dry lips--mine are just shy of chapped. Then there's the text book of whacky weather.Warm,cold,humid,whipping wind then freezing again.It's dry in the house and debatable outside. Lip products(all varieties) are becoming empty display shelves. So glad I bought and tried this product. It looks glamorous next to the humidifier and the big gulp of water. Thanks!

I love everything about it My lips tend to dry out very easily and most other sticks or balms I've tried over the years just don't do anything for me. Instead of moisturizing my lips they just leave a heavy, waxy residue that eventually congeals into a white film that I have to awkwardly wipe off. Yeah, not a pretty sight. But the other day I saw this in the store by chance. I like milk, I like honey, and there were only two tubes left on the shelf so I figured it was worth a try. I'm a guy so I didn't want something that would be overly fragrant or glossy, and I couldn't be more pleased with this. The scent and flavor of milk and honey is very subtle (yet delicious!) and it is light enough so it doesn't leave any sort of sheen or residue. After a week of use my lips are noticeably softer, healthier, and more hydrated. The only downside is that it softens up very quickly in my pocket due to body heat and it makes me worry about it melting in the warmer summer months. For women with purses that shouldn't be a problem. Other than that I love the product and I will continue to buy it as long as Nivea continues to make it! (Hint hint- please never discontinue it, I beg of you!)
Missing cocoa Miss the shade cocoa! Bring it back. None other compares.

Best Lip Balm Ever Being a girl I have tried a TON of different lip balms, but none are as pleasant as Nivea. The two main attractions for me are the taste and how well it moisturizes. It has a light scent and little to no flavor, so whenever I lick my lips my mouth doesn't fill with an overwhelmingly nasty flavor, as experienced with other brands like Lacura and Blistex. Also, for the past two years that I have been addicted to Nivea, my lips have never once pealed or cracked, as experienced with Chapstick. It is a very light lip balm too, so it never feels like there is oozy sticky stuff on your lips. I definitely recommend this stuff because it is AMAZING.

The best Nivea lip balm A Kiss Of Milk And Honey Soothing Lip Care is the best lip balm I have ever used. It's surprising how different the Nivea Lip Balm Sticks are from each other. It was my go-to lip product for years and I'm sparingly using the last of it. The same applies to a friend of mine. Both of us are dismayed and none of the other colors is just right. I selected 1 star to reflect my disappointment, but it would have been a 5 if the perfect color for me, and obviously others, hadn't been eliminated. Please bring Cocoa back!

BRING BACK COCOA I have been purchasing the cocoa lip shimmer for as long as I can remember. I regularly have 5 or more of these floating around purses, make up bags, my desk at work, my car, everywhere. I was so upset to hear that this color has been discontinued. I know several girls at the office use this product too and we joke about how much we Rely on it. Please bring back cocoa. I attempted the plum tonight and hate it . . . fig isn't good either. I am very disappointed in ending a product that was loved by so many.

What happened to Merlot! I just found out that Merlot is discontinued! Terrible news! I also read several reviews on Cocoa, which was apparently discontinued and brought back. I think the same should be done with Merlot. I checked on ebay and people are selling it for outrageous prices, which is an indicator that there are lots of other folks who feel like me! Please bring it back! It was the perfect shade of red, and you don't have other reds now...only pinks, browns, but nothing that dark. Loved it!

Please Bring Back Cocoa No, I can't recommend this product to a friend because it no longer is available. I can't give it a 5 star excellent rating either, because I can no longer purchase the product. I just returned home after searching several stores for my favorite lip gloss. To my dismay I discovered that the shade Cocoa has been discontinued. Why It's the best color for me. I've been using it for years. I also see that there are many more like me that want you to bring back Cocoa. Not even one of the other shades work for me. Please, I hope you are listening.

Old Formula was SO much better!! I recently bought two tubes of lip shimmer. I LOVE the lip shimmer I had in the past. HOWEVER, the new formulation is NOT GOOD!! I applied the lip shimmer and realized that it was totally rancid. I looked at the ingredients and see that they've changed the formulation to include soy oil and canola oil....both of these oils go rancid VERY quickly and actually promote free radical damage because they are unstable oils. I am returning the two tubes immediately. Burts Bees.....PLEASE return to the previous formula. Rancid oils are no good!!

I with the rest of the group! I do not normally do this sort of thing, but once I logged in and saw the other comments, I decided I should have my say also. I hate lipstick-I hate the way it feels and I hate the ingredients. The only product I like to use is the Lip Shimmer, and it is a fantastic product-one that I have introduced many people to over the years! Like a lot of the other folks on here, COCOA is the only shade that works with my skin tone-all of the others are too light or orange-y. We are not all as fortunate as the reviewer in Hawaii that can use any of the colors! I am devastated that COCOA is no longer available, devastated I tell you. I cannot find any other color close to this and have even tried mixing two colors, but nothing seems to work. Which means, I have had to stop using this product all together and that just makes me sad. I have used BB products for years and now I am a little disheartened by this-so, I hope that you do listen to your fans and bring our cocoa back. PLEASE
GREAT PRODUCT! This truly is a great product! It has a very clean smell, and it actually works for Fine Lines wrinkles

BRING BACK PAPAYA LIP SHIMMER The Lip Shimmers line is great. I have particularly been a fan of the Papaya color ever since I first saw it years ago. It is (was) a great color with bronze/brown tones that worked well for my tones. I got compliments all the time. Apparently Burt's Bees has elected to revamp these colors for no apparent reason, and all of these new colors are very pink toned. You will notice that all of the many, many complaints are from people who preferred bronze or brown tones who have been left behind by this change. I am at a loss to explain why this company would ignore such brand loyalty by changing these colors for essentially no reason, and while providing no acceptable substitute. Please reconsider this decision to provide only pink-toned Lip Shimmers, and bring back the bronze-toned ones, especially wonderful Papaya!

Stick goes up, but does not come down-4 tubes I am only giving one star, because of my wasted time. I bought the first tube at a drug store. Love the color on me (Plum). The next day, I rolled it up a little for more coverage and it would not roll back down. Went back to the drug store and returned it for a new tube. Tried it in the store and it rolled up a little and it rolled down. I left the store, got in my car, while driving, I went to apply...rolled it up, applied, then it would not roll down. So I made a u turn and went back to the store. This happened on 4 trips. DANG, FIX THE TUBES.

MAKE HISTORY WITH COCOA I am sure if you advertised the return of Cocoa and set a release date, you would sell out that day! Can you imagine the publicity you could generate from the whole Cocoa following! All of the ad possibilities... Commercials with real women scrambling to buy it out... If the company has no plans to bring back Cocoa at this time, then maybe they should fire the marketing department and hire me. The new shades do not compare to the old ones as evidenced by your own customer forum. I would not recommend the new shades to anyone. They don't even compare to the old ones.
Ruined the colors Bring back the old rhubarb - the new tone is too red.
not too great didn't like the texture nor the toffee shade. it felt like i was wearing saran wrap on my lips.
Short lasting I love the colors and goes on smooth and even. Unfortunately it doesn't stay on long. Comes on even without eating or drinking. Seems to rub off with speaking.
To shimmery! It was too shimmery and made me feel like I was wearing a child's chapstick. The color was fine but if the sparkle was toned down I would have no problems with it.
hmmmm my husband bought one for me because he know how much i love those products. Well i hate it !! it makes my lips totally dry, and the color is way too intense, for sure it stayed too long...
Nice shimmer but... I do very much love how this product adds a shimmery look to my lips... it's just that I find it to be too sticky! I don't use it as often as I'd like for this reason. :(
color-less Love the Lip Shimmer feel, but the color I bought (Grapefruit) didn't give me the light pink color I was after. Instead, my lips looked white and pasty. Had to throw it out.
Product smell good Because they have use some kind of good fragnense in that

Poor color selection! I have used the cocoa lip shimmer for years and I love it, but it has been discontinued. I have tried several of the new colors but have wasted my money as none of these compare to the Cocoa. I know that Cocoa was a popular color because it was always out of stock. Hoping that Burt's Bee will bring back Cocoa soon!!!

This product stains skin I bought this product thinking I would love it because I love the clear regular burts bees, but this berry color easily comes off when you drink anything and if you accidentally get it on your skin around your lips good luck getting it off...it just makes your skin look irritated and red. Not my favorite unfortunately.

What happened As a faithful user (and recommender) of the nutmeg lip shimmer for several years, I was pretty upset to find that my recent replacement was now sticky, with weak color, no feeling of peppermint, and didn't last. Did the recipe change (The label is the same.) Please say I can get the original quality back somehow.

not great color i didn't care for the two colors that i purchased, which i think were guava + rhubarb. they went on like a colored soft chapstick lip balm and i guess i was hoping for more of a lipstick or lipgloss texture. sad to say that i won't be buying these again, although i like the natural ingredients. they were fairly expensive too, considering.

Not for Dry Lips My lips tend to get dry easily and this product didn't effectively hydrate them. In fact, it highlighted the dry ridges on my lips in quite an unflattering way. It was fine appearance-wise if I had just exfoliated my lips, but dreadful otherwise. I ended up having to buy a different product. It's probably good for those with normal lips.

Where have the good colors gone This was a great product, but now the colors my friends and I have used in the past are no longer available.We wasted a lot of time walking the aisles of many, many stores searching for our colors. Why do you do this We have tried several of your other colors and do not like them. I'm giving two stars because of your color choices. Please return to the colors such as Nutmeg and Toffee. My friends and I are currently using other products, but would return to Burt's Bees Lip Shimmer if you added the old colors back to your collection.

Natural is not all fruits and veggies I used to be a big fan of Burts Bees, but have recently scrutinized the ingredients of every product I use.I am an avid make up fan with a medical and scientific research background. The ingredient carmine is actually acquired from killing a certain type of beetle. It is a pinkish/red dye which comes from this bug and we put it all over our face. Some people don't really care but I think it's a little icky. Carmine is also has other names, can't recall exactly, like Red 4 and some others. This information is easy to find. I think it's interesting that all of the fruit oils are given their pleasant names however carmine does not say beetle dye in parentheses next to the ingredient name. When I wore this lip shimmer prior to gaining this knowledge, I did enjoy the colors and the conditioning properties. Burt's Bees is a good company, but not as perfect as everyone believes. Better than many others. I have stopped using this product and the many others containing carmine from all brands, including Dior, MAC, Benefit, and countless others.Though it appears that the color radiance is lacking the beetle dye.

too much pigment when I was a kid, I used to make lip color by grinding up blush and mixing it with lip balm. burt's lip shimmer reminds me of that. there is too much pigment and it sits on top of the lips. not very sheer. so the first application looks ok but if you want to re-apply it builds up and looks thick and uneven. merlot would have been the perfect color, but it was too pigment heavy -- you have to look in the mirror when you apply it. if they eased up on the pigment a little, it would be great. I prefer balms that look like a transparent berry stain, and this is not it. it's more like a dark lipstick. unfortunately, their ligher colors are no better. they're lighter, but they're still not sheer.
cocoa Please bring back that shade back. Very disappointed.
We miss COCOA NUTMEG! Please bring back COCOA for my mother-in law and NUTMEG for myself. We miss our favorite colors!!!!

This product performs as advertised I have been very pleased with this product from Olay. It truly does moisturize my very dry skin. It is easy to dispense the product by just pressing on the top of the container, and dispenses just the right amount per press. I would recommend Regenerist Deep Hydration Cream to anyone who has dry skin like mine. This review was collected as part of a promotion.
Cocoa Please being cocoa back!! It's the only shade I wear!!! Make some more and I'm sure it will sell out!!
so-so its moisturizing smells good go's on smooth and feels great but I wish the colors lighter than watermelon had less sparkle.
Woe is me. The Rhubarb shade has changed. Why!! This was for me the perfect shade for a natural look but you have changed it! How Why Are there any old tubes left. Can I buy them
bummer I bought this and used it once. I thought it was gonig to be a LIGHT tint. So I got kinda a brown color. NO it looked like full on lipstick. Not my scene.

No COCOA very disappointed!!!! started buying your products be/ca Cocoa Lip Shimmer! Been to stores find out discontinued.Hm I have purchased both plum and fig- hoping.just used once they at the bottom of bag

Great formula, terrible shade. I tried the champagne shade of this lip shimmer. I loved the way the lip balm feels and moisturizes, but the color is a little too light and shimmery. I think the plain tinted lip balms will be better suited to my needs.

Crazy for Cocoa I am so bummed that the Cocoa Lip Shimmer has been discontinued. I lived on that. Unfortunately, that was the only color I liked (I've tried them all), so Burt's Bees has lost me as a customer unless they bring that one back. I'm so bummed. :(

Lovely color, doesn't last I'm in love with Plum - the color is just gorgeous! Unfortunately, it fades fast! I have to reapply 3-4 times during the work day at my desk job :/ Wish the beautiful color stayed vibrant longer.

Love the product, miss the color Burts Bees broke my heart when they discontinued the Cocoa Lip Shimmer color. This was my favorite lip product of all time. I put it on throughout the day, by itself or in combination with brighter shades of lipstick, and got so many compliments. None of the other colors work for me. Boo hoo!

miss my color Coming from someone who never wore make-up. I finally found a lip product and color that I loved. Cocoa. Obviously I am not alone in wishing you would bring the color back. P.S. a friend of mine work also wore the same color and is also very disappointed that she can no longer find it anywhere. Please bring back Cocoa.

Worth the money My family is on a very tight budget, so spending 20 for facial cream was a big chunk out of my grocery . But this is well worth it. My rapidly maturing skin is getting smoother. I still have my wrinkles, but they are not so pronounced. I will watch for sales coupons, this is one product that I will keep using.

Good as lip balm but not as a lipstick It was moisturizing just like the beewax lip balm. I did not particularly like it as a lipstick however. The soft and moisturizing nature of the lip shimmer makes it too delicate and soft to be used. It does not operate well as other lipstick as it sometimes get stuck inside the tube. I would rather just use the beewax lip balm instead.

Meh I received two of these lip shimmers in a mystery grab bag, and frankly they weren't quite what I was expecting. They felt a lot more like a lipstick than a lip shimmer, and unless I really caked it on, it felt a little dry (Though that could be because my lips are very dry in general). My coloring is very pale, so I think I will stick with the Pomegranate Lip Balm so lip color doesn't overwhelm the rest of my face.

Where are Papaya and (a darker rust) can't rememb I am a strawberry blond with green eyes. I look great in Papaya and the next darker rust color that you used to carry. I had multiples of each color in many spots in my life. I have really missed you making colors available for those of us who do not look good in more cooler colors. Please bring back warmer medium dark shades. I love your products otherwise. I do w ish your twist tubes worked a little better.

BRING BACK COCOA!! Please bring back Cocoa lip shimmer! This was my signature color, and I am so disappointed it has been discontinued. None of your current shades work. I used Cocoa for years and often bought several at a time, since the shade was always sold out. Don't understand why you would fix something that was not broken. I no longer use any of the lip shimmers, as I have not found another shade I like.

Vick's Vapor Rub I like the texture color (Rhubarb) but what is with Burt's Bee's lip products Every one I have tried feels like I have Vick's Vapor Rub on. Peppermint oil, maybe Although my nose felt clearer wearing this ':-/ it is too much for me and I will have to hand this off to my daughter who loves all Burt's Bee's lip balm. It would also be nice if they would offer a lip balm with sunscreen.

Love the scent, but... Love the scent and lip-feel of these products, but the colors are a bit garish on my pale skin. I tried several different colors hoping to find something that would look right on me, but to no avail. I love the concept of a tinted lip shimmer, but am dssapointed that the colors Burt's ended up with were so....bright. And I do wear dark lipstick. But these colors just didn't do it for me.

Where's Nutmeg I love your Lip Shimmer products. But I miss the color Nutmeg. It looked good on everyone and none of your new shades can replace it. If I combine Caramel and Fig they sort of look like Nutmeg. But I have to apply them in just the right order and amount. I shouldn't have to do that. And I shouldn't have to carry two colors with me all the time. PLEASE BRING BACK NUTMEG! I'M BEGGING YOU!

lip shimmer cocoa i echo all the other reviews and pleas to please bring back cocoa lip shimmer,,,,,,,i have tried every web site , no luck finding it,, i have no idea why you would discontinue that gorgeous color, it looks good on everyone, and i use it for my primary lipstick,,,,, LISTEN TO YOUR CUSTOMRS,,BRING IT BACK!! THANKS CAMILLE CUOCO,I WILL NO LONGER RECOMMEND AS YOU DISCONTINUE,POPULAR COLORS AND DO NOT LISTEN TO THE MAJORITY OF YOUR CUSTOMERS TO BRING IT BACK,BRING BACK COCOA!!

Allergy problem I got this for my mom in merlot. I haven't tried it myself. She initially liked the color and the texture. But after a few days of use it seemed to dry up her lips and the skin around her lips was irritated and dry. She might not have tolerated one of the ingredients, or might be allergic to something (though she has no known allergy). She, unfortunately, had to stop using it and had a similar problem with the Radiance Lip Shimmer. I'm sure lots of other people have used it without any problems and like it a lot.

Love the Product, not the Tube I'm glad to see that there are others out there who are experiencing the same thing as me. I love this product, have been wearing it instead of lipstick for years. I recommend it to all who admire my lip look. BUT, I never get to use the whole lip shimmer because the swivel mechanism stops working and there's so much product still left on the center stick. I phoned today and the gal told me I was the first to complain, but when I looked at the product reviews on this website there are others who ae experiencing the same thing and apparently they exchange the wonky device at the store. That must got tiresome. I guess I'll go to a beauty supply shop, buy an empty lip pot and try to salvage the product to use with a lip brush.

Ambi soap I have used this soap for years and considered it Wal-Mart's best kept secret. I was so disappointed when they stopped carrying it in our store location. Was delighted to see I could get it online it ended up a blessing. I don't go to Wal-Mart as often so I'm saving money there (Sorry Walmart), delivery was prompt, I stockpiled and never left the house.
6623443094 It smell just amazing and feels great on my skin and leave it feeling so soft.
Cocoa is back!!! Thank you for brining this color back. I love it so
looks and feels great the tingly feeling is great. i always get fig and i love the color.

Good. Its like a 2 in 1. Chapstick and shimmer:) i love it!
My Favorite Lip Shimmer I love MERLOT shimmer! Bring it back soon! PLEASE!
Love it! Adds just enough color-leaves my lips soft, doesn't smudge, lasts a while. This review was collected as part of a promotion.
Love this stuff! Nice selection of colors, and looks great, not too gaudy looking. Natural.
New Formula! The formula changed because it used to have lead in it. I still like it, though!
lip shimmer Merlot is a great color and as always lip shimmers provide great moisture
This a pretty good lip shimmer This lip shimmer stays on and comes in a wide variety of colors. I just don't like the scent.

i Love this product I'm a 52 year old with dry skin and really need a cream that can hydrate me. when i use this cream i actually feel like me skin is saying Ahhhh. i'm really glad i found the whole Regenerist line. The older i get the more i find i need more and more hydration so Thank you This review was collected as part of a promotion.
Nice shimmer Nice shimmer and moisturizing lip balm. Taste is okay, not as good as peppermint lip balm.
Great Lip Color It lasts about as long as lip balm and can be difficult to find the right color but is a great lip shimmer.
Really nice I really like these lip shimmers, but I do wish they would stain a little better and last a little longer.

Would Recommend I thought this product was ok. I really liked the color and the way it tingled. I just wish it would last longer.
It's ok but it's not cocoa I am so disappointed that u dropped the cocoa - please, please bring it back - nothing else is quite like it!
love it, wish it lasted longer! great peppermint smell/taste and I love the subtle shimmer, I just wish that I wasn't applying it every 5 minutes!
good product for casual look This product is a good lip gloss replacement. It wasn't as thick as lip gloss, and the color was nice and sheer.
Love the color and shine Love the way the Burts Bees Lip shimmer makes my lips feel and look. I love that it gives that hint of color. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

GREAT PRODUCT This cream is the best I have tried, it has reduced my wrinkles and dry skin,it goes on very smoothly and has also helped to make my skin more even toned, I love this product and would recommend it to everyone, for most skin problems they might have. The best ever This review was collected as part of a promotion.
Love it! This adds just the right amount of shimmer to my lips and feels great when it's on! This review was collected as part of a promotion.
Please bring back cocoa Please bring back cocoa! It was the only color I can wear and otherwise I love this product. I can no longer use it!
Stop Discontinuing the BEST colors!!!! PLEASE bring Cocoa back!!! I love the Lip Shimmer, but not one of the current colors works for me. Why discontinue such a favorite!!

PLEASE BRING COCOA BACK! I'm giving 4 stars only because I want Cocoa back. Not one of the other colors is even close. Love this product but want my favorite color again!!!
BRING BACK COCOA I LOVE COCOA please bring it back!!!!! It is my favorite color. The only lip balm I wear. Cannot find it in any stores. Please,please bring it back!!!!
Love the Color! I love the raisin color! It is the perfect tint of red for me and does not feather throughout the day. The minty tingle and smell are a big plus :)

deep hydration I use this at night and sometimes when I don't wear makeup during the day, I use it then too. good tinted lip-stuff I use these and like them a lot. I tend to use the Burt's Bees regular lip-balm more often , but these are a great product for those that want a little color.

Lip Shimmer is GREAT, but please bring back Nutmeg I am a fan of Lip Shimmer, but please bring back Nutmeg! It's one of the deeper shades without being purple. And it goes well with some of our skin tones.
Great Product I love this product. The color, however, was a poor decision on my part. It is too pink for me, but it does stay on long and moisturize for a long time.
i love all the diffrent flavors i love how the lip shimmer has so many different flavors to chose from. when i wear it, it looks good and it leaves my lips moisturize for a few hours.
why have you discontinued cocoa Like many others I see, I love the cocoa shade and no other shade you have comes close. I am really bummed out to see you have discontinued it. Please bring it back!!!
Bring cocoa back, please Cocoa is my favorite color. I have searched several stores for this color to no avail. My original tube is gone. Have tried other colors, but do not like them as well.
Nice Product I like that this product is natural. It feels nice on my lips and I especially like the watermelon color. The drawback is that it comes off when I drink or eat.
Bring back Cocoa So disappointed that Cocoa is discontinued. Haven't found a lip shimmer color I like to replace it. All are too red or pink. Hope you will consider bringing it back.

Great replacement for expensive lipsticks! I love this stuff-- though it doesn't leave lips feeling as refreshing as the original. I wore the pomegranate one on my wedding day as a more natural color look. It was fantastic!
A Hint Of Color This is a great everyday lip balm with just a hint of color. I have it in Champagne and Rhubarb. The Champagne was a little too pale and sparkly for my taste, but I love the Rhubarb.

Read the ingredients' list My overall opinion - it is a great cream if you do not have comedones or acne because one of the top ingredients is Dimethicone - a silicone based polymer. It is large molecule and may clog your pores, therefore the condition of your skin will get worse This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Great Color The Plum shade is my favorite. It has fantastic color that goes with almost everything I own, and it is incredibly moisturizing. I do wish that it was a little more resilient though. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Good product I really like this product. It feels great going on your lips and comes in a wide range of colors. My favorite is Raisin. My only complaint is that I have to reapply it a lot.
Toffee color I used my last Toffee color lip shimmer awhile back...can't find it anymore. Guess they did away with it also, like they did Cocoa I used Toffee and Champagne all the time.
Nutmeg Oh please bring back nutmeg! I have been looking forever. Is there any color you offer at this time that is close or possibly the same color with a different name : (
Bring Cocoa Back PLEASE!!! I agree with so many reviewers here. This is my favorite every day lip color, but Cocoa was by far the best shade. Please, oh please bring it back ASAP as I'm out!!!
Great Color! I'm not one who likes bright colors, so I bought the Caramel shade of this. It's terrific! It gives me just a bit of color, lots of shimmer - and it looks natural.

cocoa lip shimmer I like burts bees products, but my color was discontinued! it was the only color I liked was the only one that didn't contain apricot kernel oil (which makes me itchy). please bring it back!

disappointing Why do you keep taking away all the great brown family, cacoa. coffee. your other colors are just to red,cacoa was the perfect shade for the ladies who love the brown family.bring it back please.

Nutmeg I miss Nutmeg! It was the perfect shade to brighten up my face without using alot of blusher. Now it is gone and nothing has really replaced it adequately. I don't want to go back to lipstick. Please bring Nutmeg back.
Wth Very good product my mom uses it all the time when she loves it very much swears by it

I miss Cocoa! I am so disappointed that the Cocoa Lip Shimmer has been discontinued. I haven't been able to find any small, keep-it-in-your-pocket lip color that I like. Please bring Cocoa back! You're losing me, Burt :(

Merlot - lip shimmer I love these lip shimmers. They have a mintu taste and moisturize lips well. Some of the colors rub and end up on front teeth. The merlot is the reddest of the reds and I just love theis color.

Yummy! Love the way this product looks, feels, and tastes on my lips. Also, the color, fig, is really neutral with just the right amount of color and shine. Love it! This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Looks great! My lips get very dry, so wearing lipstick is not the best for me. I tried this lip shimmer in plum. I love the way it looks! My lips dont get chapped from it. I'm very happy with this product. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Fun alternative to lipstick I'm not comfortable wearing makeup, but lip shimmer is a great alternative to lipstick when you want a little bit of color and a bit of fun. It absorbs well, so no sticky feeling left, and a little bit goes a long way. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

BRING BACK PAPAYA COCOA lip shimmers I LOVE PAPAYA, and have used it for 5+years. WHY DID IT GET DISCONTINUED. For us warm undertoned ladies, papaya and cocoa are the best for us. Your other colors are too pink or red. PLEASE BRING BACK PAPAYA AND COCOA.

Love it I love this stuff. The color selection is good, the moisturization is great, and, while it doesn't last nearly as long as lipstick, it lasts way longer than gloss. The taste and texture are also infinitely better than normal lipstick.

Missing Nutmeg I have been using your Nutmeg Lip Shimmer for several years love it, but can't find it anymore. Has it been discontinued I like the product so much and that color is the only one that works for me. Hoping you'll bring it back!

Where or where did my Nutmeg go No current color you have in Lip Shimmer compares to Nutmeg. My gal friends all love it and want it back....pronto....Why change a color that everyone loves I have been looking everywhere for it, now I know why I can't find it.

Lovely I purchased the Peony shade. I'm very fair skinned, but it is flattering. I love the minty flavor and the pretty sheen. I feel like I reapply this more than other glosses, but enjoy the look enough to bear the burden of reapplication.
it feels great. not greasy. This product feels great and not greasy. I noticed less visible lines

what happened to cocoa I join others to say please bring cocoa back. I am so surprised and disappointed that you don't offer it anymore. It's a great color...very classy, not bright and garish like some. Please return cocoa...it is the only color I like.

Nice shimmer This gives just a touch of color. I could live without the strong peppermint tingling. It bothers my sensitive skin a bit. The color doesn't seem to last very long either, but it's very pretty and a nice option for on the go.

An old favorite I first used these in middle school, and they are still a favorite to this day. In the winter, I recommend using a layer of Burt's classic balm underneath to help with hydration and to compliment the shimmers' peppermint flavor. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Nice color and lightweight I like the Lip Shimmer because it goes on smoothly and has a lightweight feel. The color isn't overwhelming, not too light or dark and the scent is pleasant. It also helps keep my lips soft. My favorite color is rhubarb. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Only lip color I wear I am admittedly not a big lipstick fan, but I do love the normal Burt's Bees chap stick and so this is a wonderful combination. I get the moisturizing and nice feeling of the chap stick and I get a touch of color without it being too harsh.

Moderation is Key I bought this product in Champagne, and found it's a bit too light for my skin tone (light/medium with yellow undertones), so I only use it when I go out at night. The one downside is if I use too much, it ends up looking cakey on my lips.

Nice, yet drying When wanting to add some color without all the chemicals I reach for this but! before I reach for this I reach for a balm to add moisture, because if my lips are not pre-moisturized they get dry after an hour or so of wearing lip shimmer

Love Lip Shimmers I only gave 4 stars as I thought the Cherry color could have been a tad darker but I still like it very much. The shimmers make your lips so soft. Great for running errands during the day when I don't want to wear lipstick. Keep the colors coming, Burt's!!!

Good, but... I like the lip shimmer and have it in a couple different colors, I just wish it didn't have the lipstick smell to it. I always feel like I am kissing my Grandma when I put this on. I do like it though, just enough color and the great Burts Bees tingle.

Too Many Lip Shimmer Pink/Rose Tones I agree with the other writers about too many pink/rose shades and not enough peach/coppery ones. I can't find Papaya at all locally and haven't seen Nutmeg but bought both on-line. Burt's Bees, are you listening We want shades suitable for redheads.
Very effective This product Works fine just like they advertised, i really love using it,

Love it, BUT... I love this product! It adds a perfect color while also feeling super nourishing on the lips! Only thing is... BRING BACK NUTMEG. My mom and I were avid Nutmeg users and we're both super bummed that it isn't sold in that color anymore! Still love this product, though!

lip shimmer cocoa I love Cocoa and they discontinued it. Why would they do that It was the best color and great ingredients. Can't live without it. I did buy the last 50 when it was closing out and am still looking for more in the stores that have left overs. Boo hoo, Susan J.

lip shimmer i love the color, i bought fig and plum, they both look great on me. those colors have a subtle shimmer. the only problem is that the peppermint oil has a sort of weird feeling, but it's not too bad. u should check for allergies to peppermint oil before buying this

Coffee I loved coffee color. When this was discontinued, I went around all the stores around my area and internet and bought all available coffee lip shimmers. (You can guess how many I got... hehe) Please bring back coffee, pleeeeease!!

Cocoa Lip Color What happen I need my Cocoa color. I have been using it for years. I am so upset. I can not find any other brand or color I like better then the cocoa. Please bring it back. Even if it's only available online for people to purchase.

great product, however.... This is a very good lip shimmer, beautiful colors (so far I tried 3 of them), feels so good when you put it on your lips on hot summer day, it makes them feel cool. However.... with winter coming... I think I will switch to tinted lip balm, because of this cooling effect )

Lovely! Love the feel, love the lasting, love the color. Unfortunately the screw up/screw down fails in the screw down mode, so my tube is now somewhat messy. But it won't stop me from buying more, as I'm assuming that this particular tube is just defective. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Cocoa is my number one! I've tried 3 colors, but Cocoa is my number one color because it has great lasting power! It does fade away when I'm drinking or eating, but very nicely. I love the feeling when I apply it on my lips, very soothing with a hint of mint. I have olive skin and works really nice.

Depends On The Color This product has a nice, subtle mint scent and taste. It soaks into lips and moisturizes well. While the deeper colors it comes in are very nice, I found that the color tended to wipe off and smudge into an uneven look. I recommend the color free, light shimmer shade called Radiance.

BRING BACK THE TOFFEE AND COCOA I love this lip balm and have been a devoted buyer for 5 years. I am considering switching to something else because they don't make the only 2 colors I wear...Toffee and Coca. Both my sister and I love them, but we'll have to switch b/c no other color works...too pink/orange. PLEASE bring it back.
not greasy! works nicely, evens out skin tone and doen't leaave a greasy feel.Will keep using! This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Lip Shimmer I LOVE THIS PRODUCT but,,,,, PLEASE BRING BACK THE COCOA... I love that color and none of the other ones work for me. I was also using another color Toffee since I couldnt get Cocoa and you stop making that one too... PLEASE BRING THE COCOA BACK let me know when I can get it. Thanks,

Lip balm with color! I got a 3 pack of this product as a gift. It came in 3 different colors. One of the colors did not look good on me so I gave it to a friend who loved it as much as I did. It's kind of like the lip balm that I love so much but with color. I love the clear one that just gives a simple shimmer.

The best of both worlds Excellent for when you still want the bright freshness of the peppermint lip balms but also a little bit of color. These are grand in the cold weather months especially. It applies smoothly, with even color, and is rich and plentiful. Not quite as long-lasting as other lipsticks, but I still like it.

Lovely natural color I really like Burts Bees Lip Shimmers. The lip shimmers have a nice natural color to them and a hint of shimmer that is very flattering and makes my lips pop! Since my skin is very fair, the colors are perfect and work well for me. On the down side, they are pricey compared to other brands of lip balm.

Feels good I love the way the lip shimmer feels - smooth and creamy - and I love the minty tingle. The only thing I'm not crazy about is the color of the toffee - it has a bit too much white in it. I find that I usually wear the BB super shiny lipgloss over it to tone down the whiteness and to add some shine.

Bring back Cocoa! In agreement with 99 percent of these reviews, please bring back Cocoa! This was the perfect color for me and all other Burt's bees color have too much red pink or orange. I used to purchase these 5 or 6 at a time from my local drug store because it was always running out of stock it was so popular!

Bring Back COCOA!!! I love the lip shimmers have several colors. I don't wear a lot of makeup like that I can feel like I'm wearing lip balm with the added boost of color. That being said I am very sad that I can't find my favorite color Cocoa anymore! That was my go to color for every day I bought 4 at a time! Please bring this beautiful shade back!!!

One of Two Burt's Bees Lip Shimmers are one of the only products I put on my lips. I have thrown out all of my other toxic lip colors and strictly use the Lip Shimmer: I am fair skinned and found a wide range of the colors look good on me. I alternate between: Champagne Guava Watermelon Rhubarb Raisin I can't wait to try Peony and Caramel!

Cocoa Lip Shimmer I never write comments but feel strongly with this one. I love your product but would like the cocoa reinstated. It is my favorite and was the only color I ever used. The Lip Shimmer is the one lip product I never leave home without. It is great at moisturizing without drying out or feeling sticky and the slight color is an added bonus!

Nice color! I really like the way that the color looks on my lips- it's definitely a lip shimmer but it's a light color, not like lipstick. My only criticism of this product is that it feels a little scratchy when I apply it- it doesn't go on smoothly and it doesn't feel very creamy. It's nothing that would deter me from purchasing it though!

Hydration is REAL!! My Mom used Oil of Olay when I was younger and her skin was always beautiful. But I thought it was just natural. Then I tried the Regenerist and in a WEEK my skin was visibly softer, smoother and actually supple!! I CANNOT BELIEVE I have a soft face. You have to try this because if it made this drastic change in my rough, dry, peeling skin it will work on ANYONE!! This review was collected as part of a promotion.

Looks pretty while it lasts I got this in rhubarb, which doesn't sound good but it actually looks pretty. It's a nice color of deep pink- not too light, not too dark. It goes on sheer and smells and feels just like the plain original lip balm, which I loved. The only con that I came across is the color doesn't last very long. Overall, though, I really like it.

Please bring back Nutmeg! Please bring back Nutmeg! I've worn Nutmeg for years - it's just the right balance of color without being too dark, too light or too red - it's perfect for my skin tone. I've got jeans with the outline of a lip shimmer faded into the pocket - it's always there! I've tried other colors, but nothing quite compares.

Cocoa Curious I just purchased the Peony, and it has more of an orange hue than I would like. I seem to pick out alot of lip colors I have this same problem with. I'm looking for a natural tone to light pink tone without an orange tint, if anyone can help me It looks like Burts Bees should bring back this requested Cocoa!

Papaya and Nutmeg gone I have been purchasing the Lip Shimmers for many years and although I have tried just about every color, Papaya and Nutmeg go best with my skin color. Today, after searching 3 stores, I couldn't find them, so thought I would check your website. Gone for goodPlease, Please, Please at least bring Papaya back!

Where did Coca go You sooo need to bring Coca back!!! I don't like wearing lipstick especially in the summer. Burt's Bees gave me an option of keeping my lips soft with color but they too Coca AWAY!! All of the 4 other different colors I have tired just look awful on me and it hasn't matter which season we are in. PLEASE PLEASE IT BACK!!!!

Bring back Cocoa, please I ADORE this product. Over the years, I've tried MANY lipsticks. Never found one I like until I found the cocoa color of this product. Since it was discontinued, I've tried 5 other colors, none of which work for me. I would have rated this product 5 of 5, except that the color I came on the website to find is no longer made.

Colors for pale skin What I love about Burt's Bee's lip shimmer is that it feels good on my lips--thanks to the peppermint oil--AND it looks pretty, too. The only thing is I have trouble finding colors that aren't too--for lack of a better term--pa-ZOW on my pale face. I do like Peony, though, and I want to try Guava and Champagne eventually.

Great colors As with all Burt's Bees products, it's good to know that I can use this without worrying about toxic ingredients like parabens or pthalates. It comes in many great colors, so it's easy to find one that suits you. My favorites are peony, caramel and nutmeg. I also LOVE the minty feeling on my lips! Now if only it had spf.

Bring back Cocoa! I am so disappointed that you have discontinued the color cocoa. I rarely like any lip colors, and cocoa was perfect for my complexion and personal style, too. None of the other colors look right or are flattering to me. I love what the lip shimmers do for the condition of my lips, but I won't be using them anymore unless cocoa becomes available again.

nice light lip color i love these lip shimmes for keeping my lips moist and without that heavy lipstick feel and look. the color is definitely there, but not overwhelming and fake looking. wouldn't say they are long lasting. they stay on well as long you don't eat or drink, but are completely gone once you do. but that's ok, just reapply....they're made of natural ingredients!
